p: Lysozyme, an important class of enzyme, is a hydrophilic monopeptide chain [ 68]. It can inhibit bacterial infections, especially those caused by Gram-positive bacteria. The antimicrobial activity of lysozyme is due to its ability to hydrolyze the beta-1â€“4 glycosidic bonds between N-acetylmuramic acid and N-acetylglucosamine in peptidoglycans [ 69]. Lysozyme hydrolyzes peptidoglycan, which is the main cell wall component, destroying the cell wall, causing intracellular materials to leak out and resulting in bacterial death [ 70].
